description.narrative: In 2015 JESE and RAIN focussed on the phasing out of implementation activities in the Rwambu area while working on further recognition of the approach. In other areas, Rwebikwato, RAIN, JESE and the began to explore collaborations and applying the lessons from Rwambu

In an effort to build on the already existing efforts of the Rotary Club of Iganga, RAIN Foundation secured funds from Aqua Quest Netherlands to construct three (03) protected shallow wells Kiagara parish. RAIN Foundation through JESE constructed an additional shallow well (01), mobilised communities through groups to establish water recharge measures (soil bunds) around the 04 water sources to sustain their functionality throughout the year.

Kiyagaara parish, in Kahunge sub-county, Kamwenge District is water stressed with only (9) reliable protected water points and (49) unprotected ones in the whole parish. It has (3) head water sources for the Mubiro stream at Kabamanya hills, Kajujuma stream at Nyanja and Katabiduku at Kakira hills which is all draining in the Mpanga River. However, these sources are almost drying up as a result of poor farming practices upstream of them. In addition, consumption of contaminated water has led to the spread of water borne diseases like acute diarrheal, intestinal worms, dysentery and skin diseases which is water washed due to lack of enough clean bathing water. Many families have had to sell their land to pay for treatment in a proper hospital. On average, a family spends about 10% of the monthly household’s income per person infected
Phasing out and scaling up the Rwambu Environmental Sustainability Pilot

The projectplan details a number of activities to prepare the Rwambu area for the phasing out of the project. At the same time at Rwebikwato the project will implement 3 shallow wells combined with land management interventions.
